definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)

sentences.english: BE what naked eye could not see, water works properly to bury to zero.
sentences.chinese: 是肉眼看不到的，水灵入土为零。

sentences.english: The weight of roots increased in deep soil layer with treatment of non-irrigation.
sentences.chinese: 重肥处理根系入土深，深土层根量增加。

sentences.english: Crown depth in soil decreased with fall dormancy increasing.
sentences.chinese: 根颈入土深度随秋眠级数的增加而变浅。

sentences.english: The peasants ploughed the weeds in the field back to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 农民把地里的杂草犁入土中来肥田地。

sentences.english: Some thought he must be dead, but none knew positively.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为他一定已经入土了，但没有人能说个真切。

sentences.english: Will you forget me, and be happy with others, when I'm in my grave?'
sentences.chinese: 等我入土之后，你会忘了我，和别的人幸福地生活吗？

sentences.english: Love is the tomb of marriage, but grave is better than BaoShi street.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是婚姻的坟墓，但入土为安总比暴尸街头好。

sentences.english: Of all the possessions of this life fame is the noblest; when the body has sunk into the dust the great name still lives.
sentences.chinese: 人生最可宝贵的是声誉，躯体入土后，声誉犹存。
昨天，我丈夫入土为安了。

sentences.english: This ash soil, the fallout mud dust.
sentences.chinese: 这灰落尘入土，成泥成尘。

sentences.english: The farmers ploughed the vegetable leaves back to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 农夫们把蔬菜叶犁入土中作肥料。

sentences.english: The stalks are left to be ploughed into the earth for the next planting.
sentences.chinese: 作物的秆被留着以便犁入土中作下次播种的肥料。

sentences.english: When the forest was cleared,a lot of small branches were ploughed under.
sentences.chinese: 在砍伐森林时，人们用铧把许多小树枝翻入土中。

sentences.english: The three victims from the Newark school shootings have been buried.
sentences.chinese: 三名纽沃克校园枪击案的受害者昨天入土为安了。

definition: buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
